definitions.definition: An academic discipline that seeks truth through reasoning rather than empiricism , often attempting to provide explanations relating to general concepts such as existence and rationality.
examples: Philosophy is often divided into five major branches: logic, metaphysics, epistemology, ethics and aesthetics.

definitions.definition: A view or outlook regarding fundamental principles underlying some domain.
examples: a philosophy of government;   a philosophy of education

definitions.definition: A calm and thoughtful demeanor ; calmness of temper .
Synonym of small pica ( especially in French printing ) .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) An academic discipline that seeks truth through reasoning rather than empiricism , often attempting to provide explanations relating to general concepts such as existence and rationality.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A view or outlook regarding fundamental principles underlying some domain.
( countable ) A comprehensive system of belief .
( archaic ) A broader branch of (non-applied) science.
( uncountable , originally ) The love of wisdom .
A calm and thoughtful demeanor ; calmness of temper .
( printing , dated ) Synonym of small pica ( especially in French printing ) .
